Objectives/Activities: Mise en route; Identifier une langue (Activités 1-2); Activité 3
Details: Ice-breaking: greet each learner, form circle, exchange names; observe poster for European Day of Languages, identify word "bonjour" in many languages; listen to short language samples and identify French, English, Chinese, Polish, Portuguese, German; pair or group greetings: "Bonjour, je m’appelle..."
Observe drawings of classroom introductions; listen and associate dialogues with images; practice questions with tu/vous and spelling names; match transcribed dialogues to drawings.

Objectives/Activities: Vérifier langues parlées (Activité 11); Faire connaissance et dire la nationalité (Activités 12-13); Point Langue: adjectifs de nationalité
Details: Circle activity: ask "Je parle français. Et vous, quelle langue parlez-vous?" Introduce pronoun "nous"; listen to conversations at an international cocktail and match to drawings; fill speech bubbles with appropriate phrases; study masculine/feminine forms of nationalities and pronunciation differences.

Objectives/Activities: Point Langue: se présenter, présenter quelqu’un; Activité 14 (accentuation); Activité 15 (jeu de rôles)
Details: Complete conjugations of s’appeler and être; practice final-syllable stress through listening and repetition; find endings of prénoms; role-play cocktail scene introducing oneself, languages, nationalities; perform rapid dialogues in circle correcting major errors.

Objectives/Activities: Connaître les noms de pays (Activités 16-17); Point Langue: articles définis et genre des noms de pays
Details: Pair matching of nationalities with countries; list where languages are official; fill tables with le/la/les/l’ based on gender/number; deduce rule that country names ending in "e" are feminine, those ending in "s" are plural.

Observe cinema entrance drawing; listen and count available seats; study formation of numbers (simple/composé); listen and correct numbers, count aloud in pairs, complete number table; discriminate similar numbers; listen to fair stand numbers and write corresponding codes.

Objectives/Activities: D’un mot à l’autre (Activités 1-2); Personnalités françaises (Activités 3-4); Message secret (Activité 5); Communication en classe (Activités 1-2)
Details: Group exchange on known French words; identify transparent words from audio extracts; discuss famous French personalities by category and spell names; decode secret word using number-letter table and create encoded words; listen to classroom phrases, determine who speaks (teacher or students), read aloud and understand expressions for classroom use.
